boardgame.name: Breach & Clear: A Guide to Installations and Bases
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Breach & Clear is a GM's resource for creating installations and bases for players to explore.

From twisted, thrumming machine hives to soaring high-tech spires, Breach & Clear has everything you need to create an immersive and richly populated environment.

Features include:

Installation generator to help with mission planning or on-the-fly location creation.
A stack of themes and meta-plots to create your installation around.
Masses of traps, alarms, hazards, security measures and structural elements (walls, doors, windows etc).
A huge range of rooms and contents to add realism (and the unexpected) to your scenario.
A host of interactive installation features along with random tables to help you determine what happens if players start messing about with them.
A selection of maps along with comprehensive descriptions - examples include - FarDrive Craft, Cult Hive, Factory, UIG Station, Lab Complex and The Shanghai Noodle House.
And a Random Uniform Generator - Silver Suits and Red Hardhats all round!

boardgame.name: Crisis in Kaibo
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Delve into the eastern fantasy noir steampunk world of Mists of Akuma with this module for novice adventurers!

Trouble has arisen in the scientific prefecture of Uso as a strange mind-sapping fog becomes ever more pervasive, wrecking havoc upon the city of Kaibo. The industrial powerhouse is on the verge of descending into chaos and so a bengoshi (Sky Adept #23) deputizes the PCs and commands them to collect a sample of the so called bikkuri fog, contain its spread, and return with any knowledge they can garner about the phenomenon. It won't take long for the party to realize that something more sinister is afoot however, and though this mission involves great peril the rewards for success are commensurate—a flying machine for each adventurer!

Details on the city of Kaibo and its denizens.
The cursed oni crown and deadly demonic kanabo.
Expert ninja (CR 4), bolt-turrets (CR 1), the warlock Yoshihisa Jurobei (CR 5), the oni Yaba (CR 6), corrupted official Suganuma Koretomo (CR 2), expert archer Shimoda Koretomo (CR 4), and the rebel Uso-flyer Ubukata Eijiro (CR 4) alongside the usual smattering of adeddo-oni (hunchling CR 2, ninja CR 3).
The Hunter warlock patron and conjured shadow beast.
Four maps including Kaibo, its iron mines, Tobo-Sha Valley, and the Koretomo Estate.

boardgame.name: Team Yankee: NATO's First Line – NATO Tank Company
boardgame.description:
NATO's troops stand ready on the border awaiting the Soviet onslaught, confident in their abilities and equipment they have been given.

—description from the publisher's website

listing.notes:
3 Plastic Leopard 1 Tanks 2 Plastic Bo-105 PAH Helicopters 1 Plastic Tank Commander Sprue 1 Plastic Flight Stand 4 Decal Sheets 13 Unit Cards 1 Team Yankee Mini Rulebook NATO's troops stand ready on the border awaiting the Soviet onslaught, confident in their abilities and equipment they have been given.
Since its inception in 1949, NATO has been a community of free nations brought together with a common goal, to defend the freedom of Western Europe and North America. To do this Canada, France and the Netherlands deploy armoured and mechanised forces in West Germany.
Supplied unpainted & unassembled

boardgame.name: Punktown: A Setting Book for Call of Cthulhu and Basic Roleplaying
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

"Skyscrapers with sides so smooth and featureless (with vidscreens on the interior, instead of windows) that one might think they were solid granite monuments in a graveyard for dead gods. Other buildings that looked like they'd been pieced together from thousands of odd-matched parts salvaged from stripped factory machines, steam curling out of grids and grates in their complex flanks. Buildings with snake skins of multicolored mosaics. Buildings wearing an armor of riveted metal plates, like retired warships looming vertically with their sterns jammed into the street. Flat roofs upon which perched smaller buildings, symbiotically. Other structures tapering to needle points that seemed to etch the clouds upon the blue glass of the sky. Stacked apartments. Stacked businesses. On street level: shop fronts, and gang kids squatting on tenement steps, glaring insolentlyt at the slow trudge of traffic... Ah, Punktown."


- Jeffrey Thomas, Deadstock


Punktown: An RPG Setting for Call of Cthulhu Sixth Edition and BRP uses Chaosium's famous award-winning system to explore a dark, futuristic world fraught with untold perils created by author Jeffrey Thomas. Imagine Blade Runner, The Fifth Element, Minority Report, Total Recall and the rest of the dark, not-too-distant-future genre. Now add aliens, mutants, robots and Lovecraftian horror. Blend them together, and you get a hint of what Punktown is like.

This reference explores the city itself, the alien races, the weaponry, the creatures, mutations, cybernetics, drugs, sanity (and the inevitable loss thereof), and the options of adding the Cthulhu Mythos into the mix. As written in Thomas' work, the mythos is already there, threatening life as Punktowners know it. If you're a cyberpunk fan, if you're a horror fan, or if you're both, this book is for you.

Keep your eyes wide, your pistol close, and mind the snipes. Those who venture into Punktown never leave the same... if they leave at all.

THIS BOOK CONTAINS MATURE CONTENT

This book holds a dark mirror to our own world and explores themes including: depravity, sexual violence and other dark matter considered more suitable for adult, mature games. The GM should consult with and adapt aspects accordingly to everyone's comfort zones.

boardgame.name: Disciples of Bone & Shadow: Narrative Playbook
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

After the success and critical acclaim of Disciples of Bone & Shadow, we are very happy to introduce you to a new way of playing the game with the Narrative Playbook.

Although Disciples of Bone & Shadow's base experience provides lots of exciting gameplay twists and turns, due to the fact of having a limited amount of possible results and combinations it can become somewhat stale after a lot of playing with the same encounters and possibilities. This is when it becomes obvious that as a Dungeon Crawler, Disciples of Bone & Shadow provides a fantastic experience, but as a real Role-Playing Game, it falls short. There are no surprise elements being thrown at us, coming from the mind or script of a Game Master; there are no interesting, credible NPCs to deal with or unexpected dangers to face.

This is where Narrative Gameplay comes in. We call Narrative Gameplay the style of play that allows a player to experience the full benefits of having a Game Master, without actually having one. This is not a novel idea, there are many games out there that provide a similar experience. Our goal here is to provide the necessary tools to truly explore the unique (and lethal) world of Uzrun, allowing the player the liberty to truly choose their character's destiny, creating a unique story in the process.

In order to introduce Narrative Gameplay we had to also introduce new tools for the character and world creation, making it deeper and more detailed. As opposed to the core experience, where it is advised that you play with two characters simultaneously, this style of gameplay is also specifically tailored for being played with only one character, which means all the threats and dangers have been designed with this in mind. This doesn't mean you cannot play narratively with a friend; you will find instructions on how to do so in this new expansion!

This is also the perfect opportunity to introduce a whole new region of the Twilight: the Whiteteeth Peninsula. This desolate region lies in the south of the Fractured Dominion, in the limit of the inhabitable area. Darkness is almost complete in this region, and the few people that live here are some of the toughest in all of the Twilight, used to facing dangers of all kinds. This region comes with lots of new dangers and fresh opportunities for any adventurer desperate enough to challenge these threats and try to make a name for themselves in this frozen wasteland.

Narrative Playbook features:

A whole new way of playing the game, full of detail and deepness, and 100% compatible with the base experience found in Disciples of Bone & Shadow
A new, expanded character creation, with new active and passive skills, Personality Traits, Advantages & Disadvantages, and much more!
New spells, new gear, new magic artifacts
Three new Archetypes: the Deathbinder and the Deathwielder, defying the power of the Primordial Ones with their Korian Necromagic and control over the undead, and the Alchemoturgist, a master of potions and the art of Alchemy.
The Whiteteeth Peninsula: a new region of the world to explore, the last habitable frontier before reaching the Land of the Conquered Sun. This frozen landscape introduces lots of new dangers and possibilities for those brave enough to explore it
New encounters, enemies and threats
Dozens of new rules, from traveling and setting camp, to improved ranged combat, NPC reactions, sellswords...

boardgame.name: True Agenda
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Secret labs. UFO sightings. Abductions. What if the conspiracy theories were real? What if the governments of the world knew and condoned actions that involved putting humans at risk for monetary gain or to advance a corporate or political cause? What if government officials thought that they had complete control over advanced alien technology and held indomitable sway over these extraterrestrial beings? What could go wrong?

True Agenda puts players in the role of former military personnel hand-picked to operate in small teams to investigate and shut down these objectionable government and corporate labs and black sites housing dangerous alien lifeforms and advanced technology. Provided with prototype military weaponry, armor, and equipment, these brave operatives come face-to-face with foes ranging from shady, unscrupulous scientists and businessmen to unearthly threats powerful enough to raze entire towns.

boardgame.name: Team Yankee: Durand's Devils – French Rapid Action Group
boardgame.description:
Durand's Devils is a great way to begin building your French force with three AMX-30 tanks and two Gazelle helicopters, it provides some fantastic models that can fill many roles in your army.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: True Agenda Resource Pack
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Artemis operatives never know what they might face in the field. Therefore, they have to plan for any possibility. Increase the likelihood of survival with this first Resource Pack for the True Agenda Roleplaying Game. Inside is new equipment, more pregenerated characters, resource tiles, and even a new alien threat. Also, explore the layout of an Artemis base where the player characters can socialize and hone their skills. The fate of humanity rests on the shoulders of a few, so take every advantage you can get!

True Agenda puts players in the role of former military personnel hand-picked to operate in small teams to investigate and shut down objectionable government and corporate labs and black sites housing dangerous alien lifeforms and advanced technology. Provided with prototype military weaponry, armor, and equipment, these brave operatives come face-to-face with foes ranging from shady, unscrupulous scientists and businessmen to unearthly threats powerful enough to raze entire towns.

boardgame.name: The Alien Menace
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Operatives, get ready to face the most dangerous adversaries and most dire situations yet with all of humanity hanging in the balance. Find help against these foes with new character advancement options and equipment. Steel yourself against extraterrestrial psychic powers. Meet the first alien-human hybrids. Will they prove to be allies or among your most fierce opponents? All of this and more can be found in the pages of The Alien Threat!

True Agenda puts players in the role of former military personnel hand-picked to operate in small teams to investigate and shut down these objectionable government and corporate labs and black sites housing dangerous alien lifeforms and advanced technology. Provided with prototype military weaponry, armor, and equipment, these brave operatives come face-to-face with foes ranging from shady, unscrupulous scientists and businessmen to unearthly threats powerful enough to raze entire towns.

boardgame.name: High Seas Encounters
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Operatives, get ready to dive into two field investigations focusing on new extraterrestrial threats on and under the water. Equip yourselves with new gear to handle increasing challenges and hostile environments. Prepare to face off against additional alien races discovered along humanity’s shipping lanes within international waters. Interact with the people that make their living on the untamed waves, but are they friend or foe? All of this and more can be found in the pages of High Seas Encounters!

True Agenda puts players in the role of former military personnel hand-picked to operate in small teams to investigate and shut down these objectionable government and corporate labs and black sites housing dangerous alien lifeforms and advanced technology. Provided with prototype military weaponry, armor, and equipment, these brave operatives come face-to-face with foes ranging from shady, unscrupulous scientists and businessmen to unearthly threats powerful enough to raze entire towns.

boardgame.name: Between the Sticks Football: General Manager
boardgame.description:
This is a free PnP Game designed for the 2020 Solitaire PnP Contest. Assets available in the files link.***

You are the General Manager of a new American Football team who needs to sign all 22 starters to your roster while staying under budget. Build a balanced championship level team and win.

All players are on individual mini playing cards and have a preferred salary & stat scores for 10 critical football traits like passing, blocking, & tackling. When deciding to sign a player, you place them into a starting spot on the game board which values 3 of the 10 traits. The player's scores will generate one of 4 types of victory points (Toughness, Explosiveness, Intelligence and Skill). You win by keeping these 4 victory point totals in balance while assembling a skillful team.

With a salary cap of $500MM, you need to decide who to sign, how much to pay & what they will contribute to your overall team. Do you have the vision needed to assemble a champion?

Designed by Joe Fontana (Formulaic Games)

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: True Agenda Parody Pack
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Artemis operatives never know what they might face in the field. Therefore, they have to plan for any possibility, even love! Increase the likelihood of surviving your character’s first romantic encounter with this Parody Pack for the True Agenda Roleplaying Game. Inside these romance filled pages are new skills, new equipment, background events, resource tiles and even a new alien threat. The fate of humanity rests on the shoulders of a few, so take every advantage (wink! wink!) you can get!

True Agenda puts players in the role of former military personnel hand-picked to operate in small teams to investigate and shut down objectionable government and corporate labs and black sites housing dangerous alien lifeforms and advanced technology. Provided with prototype military weaponry, armor, and equipment, these brave operatives come face-to-face with foes ranging from shady, unscrupulous scientists and businessmen to unearthly threats powerful enough to raze entire towns.

boardgame.name: Chronofields Quick Start Rules
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Imagine fighting a war. The soldiers to your left and right are counting on you. Doing everything needed to stay alive and finish the mission comes without question. Now imagine that the war never ends. You have no known way to escape the perpetual battlefield. Those soldiers beside you are still counting on you. What would you do to lead them home safely?

Chronofields puts players in the role of veteran soldiers from one of many eras of human warfare. Through some temporal paradox, they and their unit find themselves trapped in a different time. Provisions, ammo and equipment are suddenly extremely limited vital resources. They must learn to survive and discover not only where they are, but when.

boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Imagine fighting a war. The soldiers to your left and right are counting on you. Doing everything needed to stay alive and finish the mission comes without question. Now imagine that the war never ends. You have no known way to escape the perpetual battlefield. Those soldiers beside you are still counting on you. What would you do to lead them home safely?

Provisions, ammo and equipment are suddenly extremely limited vital resources. They must learn to survive and discover not only where they are, but when.

boardgame.name: Haunting Fields
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The cries of the dying echo across the battlefield. Imagine though that those sounds never fade, and instead become a haunting cacophony that never ceases. The sounds coming from the lips of the soldiers who should have been buried with honor that instead wander the war-torn ruins looking to enact vengeance against those still living.

Chronofields puts players in the role of veteran soldiers from one of many eras of human warfare. Through some temporal paradox, they and their unit find themselves trapped in a different time. Provisions, ammo and equipment are suddenly extremely limited vital resources. They must learn to survive and discover not only where they are, but when.

boardgame.name: Yugman's Guide to Ghelspad Part Five
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Pay Heed to the Wisdom of Yugman the Sage

A century and a half after the Divine War, the titans lay defeated and scattered across Scarn and beyond. As the people of Ghelspad work to build a new world on the war-torn remnants of a fallen paradise, new heroes rise, and new threats emerge. Yugman the Sage brings an overview of these new heroes and villains, as well as the tools they use to rise to power.

Yugman's Guide to Ghelspad Part Five includes new Backgrounds for Death and Devotional societies, three new subclasses, and new rules for half-orc and minotaur player characters.

boardgame.name: The Thing: Norwegian Outpost
The Thing: Norwegischer Aussenposten
boardgame.description:
This expansion for The Thing - The Boardgame allows you to experience the events that happened at Thule Station, the Norwegian station where it all began! As for the 1982 version, the expansion lets you relive the tensest moments from the story, transporting you into the cinematic film!

The core element of the game is based on the emulation properties of the Thing, which will hide its identity under a blanket of fake humanity, but with substantial differences in the way they interact with the game and with your feelings.

Here are the key points of the expansion:

A new board, new characters, and new materials.
A new end game condition represented by the escape of the dog that will arrive at Outpost 31. IF this happens, you can play your next game of the 1982 version with a pack leader dog (a dog that behaves differently throughout the game).
A new element in the game: teeth! The Thule Station crew discovers that the Alien cannot assimilate and duplicate metal parts, so dental fillings become a way to find out if a person is definitely human, but not if they are alien. The test with the wire and the flamethrower disappears and flashlights are added with which it will be possible to carry out a test and look at the teeth of the other characters, checking for the presence or lack of fillings.
A new location is available for the Thing: The UFO! It represents the last hope of escape for the Thing, as in the movie. The final confrontation with any remaining humans will take place here. Of course, this is only an option, and just like the dog escape mentioned above, it doesn't necessarily happen! Everything will depend on your behavior, as you can win or lose in many ways!


In the 2011 film, as soon as they found out what's going on, people's behavior becomes more selfish, trying by all means to save their own lives. We therefore decided to try to include the possibility of a solitary escape, an element that will bring the level of distrust to the maximum! This also brings new mechanics, such as the ability to voluntarily sabotage vehicles even if you are human.
The expansion will contain: a new board, new characters, new cards and new tokens.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Caverns of Calamity: Goblin's Rage
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An Introductory Module for Player Characters Levels 1-3
Compatible with OSRIC and Most Fantasy RPG systems

A traveler from distant lands threatens the fragile peace of Dùn Loachas.
He brings his new gods and a desire to unite local humanoid tribes for war.
You are the only ones standing in this madman’s way, can you save the day?

Greetings adventurers and Game Masters!

I am very happy to announce release of “CAVERNS OF CALAMITY: GOBLIN’S RAGE”. This introductory level module is the second in a series of three interconnected adventures intended for neophyte adventurers of levels 1 to 3.

Synopsis: In this adventure your players will be employed by the Gnomish Advanced Research Institute (G.A.R.I. for short), an inventor’s organization. They are tasked with the search for and recovery of a rare mushroom from the other side of the known world.

The black market sellers of this rare botanical treasure (rumoured to be a pinkish-white fungus with red “blood” drops which ooze from its cap, known as the “Devil’s Tooth”) were intent in keeping their identity a secret. Unfortunately for them, once this exotic plant came to the attention of the ever inquisitive and highly resourceful gnomes they quickly discovered (through diligent sleuthing, liberal bribes and much snooping) the source of the fungi: a set of caverns in the far southern foothills of Dùn Loachas. An expedition team of G.A.R.I. researchers was organized swiftly and set off in search of these botanical rarities, but they never returned!

Unbeknown to the gnomes, their expeditionary team was walking into the dragon’s den! For the cavern was guarded by a pack of bloodthirsty humanoids, intent on keeping this valuable prize to themselves. They slew some of the gnome researchers and captured others, in hopes of quashing any outside knowledge of their valuable.

So the gnomes have turned to professional adventurers to save the day. They gnomes need the players to investigate the caverns, recover the plants they need for their research, and find and rescue members of the prior expeditionary force, if at all possible.

Are your players up to the challenge?
boardgame.rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

boardgame.name: ASCII Planets
boardgame.description:
ASCII Planets is an open source board game--written in LaTeX--in which 1–7 players lead an entire planet through the modern age into a warp-capable civilization by advancing Technology and Culture, training Population, constructing Starships, and interacting through Trade or inter-planetary conquest.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Persephone
boardgame.description:
In the traditional, diagonal form of Checkers, pieces are restricted to playing on a single color of the checkerboard. Thus it is possible to play two games simultaneously on the same board. The first game is played on the Dark squares, and the second game on the Light squares.

Also, the conventional way of playing two games simultaneously is that the player makes a move in the first game, then another move in the second game. However, in 'Persephone' the player picks between either of the two games in which he wants to move a piece. Captures still take precedence over any other move. So a player is forced to make a capture on a particular side of the board if possible.

A player wins when he manages to capture all of his opponents pieces that are on the same color of the checkerboard - either all the Light pieces or all the Dark pieces. With two games at once, the chances of a draw are greatly reduced. If one of the games is undecided, the other game can still be resolved for the win.

The two sides are Iron and Gold. Instead of pieces being referred to as Men and Kings, they are known as Maidens and Queens.

Other than this, the game follows the rules of Spanish Checkers. This is played very much like Anglo-American Checkers, the main difference is that the Queen has a more substantial move along any number of vacant squares, including ones beyond a captured piece. Captures are mandatory. If a player has a choice of captures he must take the greater number of pieces.

boardgame.name: The Heist: The Museum of Fine Art
boardgame.description:
The thief moves invisibly through the museum stealing art, disabling security cameras, avoiding the museum staff and attempting to escape before being cornered. The thief player has a privacy screen, a pad of mini maps to plot their course, locations of art and security cameras on, a thief token that gets placed on the game board if spotted by a museum staff player and two custom dice which are used to determine if an exit has been successfully unlocked. There are 4 thieves to choose from each with a unique skill.

The museum staff coordinate in order to detect and detain the thief before the thief can unlock an exit and escape the museum. The museum staff players roll a standard D6 to move their tokens around the game board, checking rooms "visually" or by checking on 1 of 12 security cameras to track, locate and corner the thief. They can also access the IT room to check and or repair all the cameras.

The game ends when either the thief has been caught or the thief has managed to escape the museum with at least 1 piece of art.

The box contains a quad fold game board, the instructions, a privacy screen, a 100 sheet pad of mini maps, 16 pieces of fine art, 15 art stands, 6 museum staff tokens, 6 museum staff cards, 1 thief token, 12 security cameras, 1 D6, 1 thief exit die, and 1 Lucky Leo thief exit die. The characters represent a variety of ages, genders and ethnic groups.

—description from the publisher

listing.notes:
Boxes are not shrink wrapped - cellophane seals used instead in order to help reduce the plastic in the world!
Shipping anywhere in Canada is $15.00.
Shipping and any duty costs for US sales are the responsibility of the buyer. Cheapest best rates will always be provided.
Email sales@coldstreamgames.ca for more information. coldstream-games-corp.square.site

boardgame.name: The Tomb of Dracula
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

A warrior in life, Vlad Tepes Dracula was born to rule. Killed more than five hundred years ago, but he did not perish. Instead, he rose from the ashes of his own death and became the Lord of the Vampires. Chosen by the first Lord of the Vampires, Varnae to be his successor and to eternally rule the creatures of the night. No longer content to rule his sovereign nation of Transylvania, Dracula has turned his desires to controlling the world with his army of living dead followers of darkness. Beware reader, that you do not
join his supernatural forces.

Inside these vaunted pages you will discover the complete history and updated statistics for Varnae, the first Lord of the Vampires.
Complete history and updated statistics for Dracula, Lord of the Vampires.
Thirty Five heroes and villains who wage the eternal war for control of the night and the protection of humanity.
Two nefarious cults who seek to gain immortality and unlimited power through invoking the fell forces of darkness.

boardgame.name: Fairy Tale Files: The Cinderella Murders
boardgame.description:
A grisly double-murder shocks Fairy Tale Land! Lady Tremaine and one of her two daughters are found stabbed at the manor. The prime suspect is the mistreated stepdaughter Cinderella - she had motive and opportunity. Could it be that simple?

Collect the clues and solve the puzzles to find out!

The Fairy Tale Files are lighthearted murder mystery detective games inspired by iconic fairy tales. We bring you the delight of your favorite childhood stories with an adult twist! Join the Magical Mishaps Agency to solve the clues and find the killer!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Vektor 2089
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Top-down sci fi racing game in the style of the Wipeout series.

boardgame.name: Waste Diggers: Animal Companions for Five Klicks From the Zone
boardgame.description:
With this expansion pack for Five Klicks From the Zone you can add an animal companion to your squad. The Waste Digger is a dog..lizard...thing.. that thrives in the wasteland and gives you both the opportunity to employ a new, somewhat unusual type of squad member and to convert and paint a fun model.

On the battle field, the Waste Digger is perfectly suited to zip forward and chew up wayward enemies or to rush in to help someone in trouble. Just watch out, as they are fairly vulnerable to fire.

This is an expansion and requires a copy of Five Klicks From the Zone to play.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Five Klicks From the Zone: Chapter 1 – Post collapse skirmish campaigns

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Riverdale
boardgame.description:
Welcome to MONOPOLY: Riverdale, a place where nothing is as it seems. Buy, sell and trade your way through the town from Pop’s Chock’lit Shoppe (home of milkshakes, meetings and murder) to the mysterious Sisters of Quiet Mercy (the mysterious locale with secrets all its own). Choose from custom sculpted tokens like Archie’s Guitar or Veronica’s Pearls, and show your inner Blossom trying to bankrupt your friends and win it all!

Includes
Custom Game Board
6 Custom tokens: Archies’s Guitar, Veronica’s Pearls, Betty’s Diary, Cheryl’s Spider Brooch, Jughead’s Hat, Pop’s Milkshake
Houses and Hotels
Community Chest and Chance cards
Custom Monopoly money
Rules

-description from publisher's website

italian edition

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Hallmark Channel
boardgame.description:
Gather your family & friends to play this special Hallmark Channel edition of MONOPOLY®. You’ll be transported right into the picturesque world of Hallmark Channel as you travel around the board and buy, sell and trade properties inspired by everything you love about the network. Whether you’re buying a Christmas Tree Farm or a Bed & Breakfast, building cottages and inns, or getting out of jail free because you started a prison knitting club, you’ll experience all the thrills of this classic game in an entirely new way!

Includes:
Gameboard
6 collectible tokens
28 title deed cards
16 Home cards
16 Family cards
2 dice
32 cottages
32 inns
1 pack of custom Hallmark Channel money

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Breaking Bad
boardgame.description:
Players will want to “tread lightly” to buy, sell, and trade properties to be the last one standing in this risky version of Monopoly based on AMC’s hit series Breaking Bad! Familiar locations and tokens based on iconic items from the show such as Heisenberg Hat, RV, Tio’s Bell and more will take fans back through the sordid evolution of Walter White and his own capitalistic plan.

boardgame.name: Turf War! Gangland Violence During Prohibition
boardgame.description:
Turf War: Gangland Violence during Prohibition is a tabletop wargame of gangsters and gun molls.
Each player is the boss of a gang of hardened criminals intent on taking over the Turf of their rivals.
The game can be played stand alone, but includes a comprehensive campaign system that includes Turf, Income, Injury, Experience, Gang building and more.

The core game play mechanics revolve around using your gangsters dice pools appropriately to gain your objectives. All dice rolls are opposed rolls looking for a Target Number, the model with the most successes wins.
However, use your dice pool carefully so you do not run out of key dice when you need them most!

Welcome to the mean streets of Turf War.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Monopoly: My Hero Academia
boardgame.description:
Build your hero team in MONOPOLY: My Hero Academia! Make your way across the board choosing between Class 1-A’s best and brightest, including fan favorite students and teachers. Draw from Go Beyond! and Plus Ultra! decks to advance your team, but make sure to avoid Detention!

Includes:
6 Custom Tokens featuring Eraserhead’s Visor, Grenade Glove, Deku’s Mask, Dummy Bomb, Shigaraki’s Hand, UA Sigil
Custom Designed Game Board
Houses & Hotels renamed Rewards & Trophies
Custom Chance & Community Chest Cards renamed Go Beyond! & Plus Ultra!
Custom themed MONOPOLY money
Rules

—description from the publisher's website

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: SPANISH EDITION

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Godzilla Monster Edition
boardgame.description:
Demolish the competition in a city-terrorizing twist on the classic board game with MONOPOLY®: Godzilla. Begin the invasion by buying, selling and trading locations like Monster Island, Goro’s Workshop, and Kitakami Lake and take over the board with Facilities and Bases. Custom sculpted tokens of giants such as Mothra, Godzilla, King Ghidorah, and Mechagodzilla easily impose on anything in their path!

Includes:
1 Game Board
6 Collectible Tokens: Godzilla, Mothra, King Ghidorah, Minilla, Mechagodzilla, Rodan
28 Title Deed Cards
32 Houses renamed FACILITIES
12 Hotels renamed BASES
16 UNGCC Cards
16 GODZILLA TOWER Cards
1 Pack of Kaiju Credit Currency
2 Dice
Rules

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: Plonk !
boardgame.description:
Plonk is a game of bluff and fun, with friends or family.
How to play ?
1- Three kangaroos and eleven cards each (six numbered 2 to 7, two Plonk! And three paw prints).
2- Shuffle your cards, uncover one, and call a number, or Plonk! to jump further! You can try the bluff, but beware, when you come across a paw print, you will have to lie!
3- If no one challenges you, move on! Otherwise, reveal your card. You lied? Hop, back! Did you tell the truth? Go ahead! and it is those who have doubted your sincerity who recoil!
4- At the end, everyone counts their points on the board.

A game that will make you jump with pleasure!

—description from the publisher (translated)


Plonk est un jeu de bluff et rigolade, en famille ou entre adultes
Comment jouer ?
1- Trois kangourous et onze cartes chacun (six numérotées de 2 à 7, deux Plonk ! et trois empreintes de pattes).
2- Mélangez vos cartes, découvrez-en une, et annoncez un chiffre, ou alors Plonk ! pour sauter plus loin ! Vous pouvez tenter le bluff, mais attention, lorsque vous tombez sur une empreinte de patte, vous serez obligé de mentir!
3- Si personne ne vous conteste, avancez ! Sinon, dévoilez votre carte. Vous aviez menti ? Hop, en arrière ! Vous aviez dit la vérité ? Allez, en avant ! et ce sont ceux qui ont douté de votre sincérité qui reculent !
4- A la fin, chacun compte ses points sur le plateau.

Un jeu qui vous fera bondir de plaisir !

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Monopoly: The Goonies
boardgame.description:
“Never say die!” with MONOPOLY: The Goonies! Go on a quest for One-Eyed Willy’s hidden treasure and buy, sell, and trade locations around Astoria, Oregon in this version based on the classic 80s adventure movie! Play with collectible tokens such as Chester Copperport’s Key, the Gold Doubloon, and other memorable items while you try to be the last player with loot!

Includes:
1 Game Board
6 Collectible Tokens: Little Girl’s Bike, Copper Bones, Gold Doubloon, Statue of David, Willy’s Eye Patch, Skull and Crossed Bones
28 Title Deed Cards
16 Chance Cards renamed HEY YOU GUYS! Cards
16 Community Chest Cards renamed NEVER SAY DIE Cards
Custom Monopoly Money
32 Houses renamed Booby Traps
12 Hotels renamed Treasure Chests
2 Dice
Rules

—description from the publisher's website

listing.notes: Will combine shipping with lowest USPS rate possible.

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Garbage Pail Kids
boardgame.description:
Relive the classic trading card game in a whole new way with MONOPOLY: Garbage Pail Kids. Featuring authentic licensed characters fans know and love. Collectible tokens include the Zit Goo Tube, Melting Eyeball, and Swirly Dog Poop as players move around the board to collect the iconic Garbage Pail Kids.

Includes
1 Game Board
6 Collectible Tokens: Zit Goo Tube, Fish Bones, Melting Eyeball, Overflowing Trash Can, Guillotine, and Swirly Dog Poop
28 Title Deed Cards
16 Never had a Chance Cards
16 Community Chester Cards
Custom Monopoly Money
32 Houses renamed GARBAGE CANS
12 Hotels renamed DUMPSTERS
2 Dice
Rules

—description from the publisher's website

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Bob Ross Edition
boardgame.description:
“Take advantage of whatever happens” in the most peaceful edition of MONOPOLY you’ve ever seen! MONOPOLY: Bob Ross is your bravery test to buy, sell, and trade favorite works of art from The Joy of Painting series. Use collectible tokens to canvas the board as a Squirrel, Pine Tree, Easel, and more as you build up Cabins and Covered Bridges, shake off taxes, and beat the devil out of others’ budgets to be the last one standing with Happy Bucks!

Includes:
Game Board
6 Collectible Tokens
28 Title Deed Cards
16 Happy Little Accidents Cards
16 The Joy of Painting Cards
32 Houses renamed Cabins
12 Hotels renamed Covered Bridges
1 pack of Bob Ross Money
2 dice
Rules

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Disney Lilo & Stitch
boardgame.description:
Say “aloha” to out-of-this-world adventure with Monopoly: Lilo & Stitch! Buy, sell and trade your favorite humble and beloved characters from the hit Disney movie in this tropical twist on the classic game. Face Galactic Federation odds and hula your way across the big island with Lilo, Nani, Stitch, and more of both alien and human kind to accumulate houses and hotels. It’s a Hawaiian rollercoaster ride to become the model citizen with the most riches, and “Ohana means family” so don’t get left behind!

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Beetlejuice
boardgame.description:
Before you call his name three times, work your way through the strange and unusual afterlife of MONOPOLY: Beetlejuice! Buy, sell, and trade your favorite dark comedy characters such as Lydia, Delia, and Charles Dietz, Adam and Barbara Maitland, and the irreverent bio-exorcist himself to haggle the living daylights out of your competition and win with more than the “ghost with the most”! It’s showtime!

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: Gotta Get Outta This Space
boardgame.description:
Gotta Get Outta This Space is a print, play and post game for 1-4 players.

You're each stuck on a planet in the robot apocalypse, and one of the last human ships has just arrived in a nearby solar system!

To play, you'll have to print, find or make components for the game.

You'll then guide a spaceship through a few solar systems, with the goal of picking you up and Getting Outta This Space.

As the ship gets improved and damaged, you’ll change the board game components in front of you, writing on some pieces, destroying others, and making new ones with whatever materials you have on hand.

Once you've finished (assuming you do, in fact, get outta this space), you'll pack up the game and send it to someone else, who'll then do the same.

Together, you might just be able to stay alive and out of reach of the new robot overlords!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Skytear: Winterdeep
boardgame.description:
Signed in Skytear infused blood and writ upon animal skins, the pact of Winterdeep declares unity between Grialth and Xotlan.
VORHILD, the White Shade, is the first sign of their army. Her magic bow, a gift from Taulot’s champions, strikes silently and from afar, while her ermine friends swarm around her chosen prey.
The ancient queen NANTACA has been awoken from her overgrown tomb. The Monarch Unliving is back, and her followers, both the living and the dead, await her commands.
—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Skytear: Stormsear
boardgame.description:
An Alliance forged by the fire of Kaeno and tempered by the winds of Utsesh, born to face the twin threats of Xotlan and Grialth.

Princess of a besieged land, KUMAYA, Ashen Maiden, fights to free her dominion once and for all. By using powers learnt from the Nuptians, she can imprison foes inside her mind palace.

SHAIDRUS, Last Light, defends its allies tirelessly using the sacred relic it used to protect. A statue animated by Divine will, all Utsesh and Kaeno has faith in its determinations.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The 7th Citadel: Les Dénicheuses
The 7th Citadel: The Unveilers
boardgame.description:
Commonly called "Unveilers", these magic-seeking ladybugs are as big as a fist but reputedly harmless, and are well-known among arcanists, treasure seekers, and other intrepid adventurers.

The Unveilers are attracted to magical emanations like flies to a rotting carcass. Spotting a cloud of these bugs is generally a good omen, but not everything that is imbued with magic is safe to dig up...

During your journey, you will certainly (Exploration card / random event) come across these ladybugs. When you do, you will put one of their miniatures into play on the Terrain card that you put in play after encountering this event. The ladybugs will remain there until you have either interacted with them (we won't tell you more, you'll have to find out for yourself) OR until you have dug to see what magical thing attracted them to the area. Then you will remove the mini and find out if you chose well… or poorly.

Will it be a powerful artifact? An arcane skeleton? A cursed object? A magical creature to fight or coax? All you have to do is dig to find out!

boardgame.name: Dungeon Fighter in the Catacombs of Gloomy Ghosts
boardgame.description:
Dungeon Fighter is back with a brand new Second Edition, 10 years after its original release!

The new Dungeon Fighter series comes in different standalone versions, each with a completely different Dungeon! You will find the good old cooperative gameplay experience with its crazy dice throws (improved with streamlined rules), unique target-board with its own gameplay elements, and of course different dice, heroes, weapons, monsters, bosses, and rooms. It’s like a completely different game each time!

Follow our heroes in the Catacombs of Gloomy Ghosts as they explore a haunted necropolis, trying to avoid meeting a grim fate at the hands of the undead! Featuring fast-rolling d12 dice and a slice-based target board for a spooky Dungeon Fighter challenge!

Be a Professional Hero! Explore the Dungeon, face weird and ferocious monsters, and fight your way to the final Boss! To defeat those fiends, you will need to use all of your focus and dexterity and throw the dice at the right spots of the main target-board.
boardgame.boardgameintegration: Dungeon Fighter in the Castle of Frightening Frosts
Dungeon Fighter in the Chambers of Malevolent Magma
Dungeon Fighter in the Labyrinth of Sinister Storms
Dungeon Fighter in the Castle of Frightening Frosts
Dungeon Fighter in the Chambers of Malevolent Magma
Dungeon Fighter in the Labyrinth of Sinister Storms

boardgame.name: Tootuf
boardgame.description:
Source: Wikipedia, "[fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Titeuf_%28jeu_vid%C3%A9o%29 Titeuf (jeu vidéo)]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Titeuf is inspired by the eponymous comic strip, created by the Swiss author Zep. The game would probably be inspired by the worlds of Mario Party, released in 1999 for the Nintendo 64 console, and South Park.

On the selection screen, two game modes are available: “La mega compet” (a board game simulator with mini-games) and “Express recreation” (which allows the player to play the mini-games directly of the first mode). At the start of the “La mega compet” level, the player can choose between four characters: Titeuf, Manu, Hugo and Nathalie. Once the character has been selected, the player takes part in 21 mini-games (or trials) which vary between games of hide and seek and urination on a bicycle; each successful test allows you to win a piece of a poster of Kevin Lover, the idol of Nadia (a friend of Titeuf). In the game, each character moves in turn, like a board game , on boxes of different colors: white, green and yellow. The white squares contain mini-games, the green squares puzzle pieces and the yellow squares contain the possibility of replaying.

boardgame.name: Taxi 2
boardgame.description: Taxi 2 (Also known as Taxi 2: Le Jeu) is a racing game published by Ubisoft for PlaySation, Sega Dreamcast, Microsoft Windows and Game boy Color only in France.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Fighter in the Castle of Frightening Frosts
boardgame.description:
Dungeon Fighter is back with a brand new Second Edition, 10 years after its original release!

The new Dungeon Fighter series comes in different standalone versions, each with a completely different Dungeon! You will find the good old cooperative gameplay experience with its crazy dice throws (improved with streamlined rules), unique target-board with its own gameplay elements, and of course different dice, heroes, weapons, monsters, bosses, and rooms. It’s like a completely different game each time!

Slide with our heroes into the frozen halls of the Castle of Frightening Frosts, an icy fortress where they are at constant risk of slipping into a frosty hell! Featuring super-sliding d4 dice and a square-themed target board for a chilling Dungeon Fighter adventure!

Be a Professional Hero! Explore the Dungeon, face weird and ferocious monsters, and fight your way to the final Boss! To defeat those fiends, you will need to use all of your focus and dexterity and throw the dice at the right spots of the main target-board.

boardgame.name: Lucky Luke: Wanted!
boardgame.description:
https://www.mobygames.com/game/lucky-luke-wanted

Based on the famous comics series about good cowboy Lucky Luke.

Now the Daltons are let out from jail and robbed the bank, and you have to chase them shooting at the bad guys, collecting extra lives, ammunition and dynamites, and collecting the four aces to access the bonus level. Meeting with the dog Rintincan is a checkpoint. Characters of the game points you where to go next.

The game is 9 (plus 4 bonus) levels in action with puzzle elements, but it has four mini-games also. The Arm-wrestling match, the Cannonball duel, the Single-shot duel, and the Cabaret Duel allow you to play with computer or with a friend, using a cable-link between consoles.

boardgame.name: Bexim's Bazaar (Issue #22 - Oct 2020)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bexim’s Bazaar is a monthly gaming magazine dedicated to RPGs and wargames… and occasionally a boardgame of interest to RPG/wargamers. GMs and players will find plenty of resources such as magic item cards, random tables, mini-adventures, and articles related to gaming as well as printable props to hand out in game. This issue contains over 70 pages of gaming content for a variety of genres and games, and gamers are welcome to submit their own content for future issues (info on submitting is found inside each issue).

Here are the contents for Bexim's Bazaar Issue #22:


Bexim's Bazaar Pages


Growder’s Tent - each month, 4 new magic item cards

Treana’s Trinkets - d20 random list of trinkets each month

The Dented Helm - each month, 4 new adventure hooks

Hewbue’s Used Books - each month, 10-15 new book titles and authors

Racker’s Auction House - 6 new auction items with lore each month

Veach’s Spellbooks - each month, 2 new spellbooks with descriptions/cost

Dolbin’s Scrolls - 3 new magic scrolls to print and provide to players each month

The Mystic Baker - each month, a new menu prop to print and hand out to players

Wanted Poster - each month, a new Wanted Dead or Alive poster with an NPC

Deed - new printable prop each month related to owning property


The Skirmish Table Pages


Hazel’s Weapons Emporium - Seller of the best (unofficial) weapons and accessories for Gaslands

Relicblade Scenario - Spectral Guard

Frostgrave Scenario - Cemetery Scavenge

Starbreach Scenario - Lifeboat Retrieval

Retro Raygun Scenario - Time Limit!

Urban Manhunt Scenario - Balls to the Walls


GM Resources Pages


DM Scotty's Wandering Monster - A stat block and image for 5e creature

A Swift Survey - A 5e mini-adventure and hand-made map from Bryan Swift

Bloodsuckers - A 5e mini-adventure from AdventureaWeek.com

Kev’s Lounge Paper Miniatures - two paper miniatures to print and make for your game


The Crafting Table Pages


Greyskull Keep- Craft Tutorial

Craft a Fortress, Part 1- Craft Tutorial

Castle Winterhawk Papercraft - Papercraft project from Fat Dragon Games

boardgame.name: Terrain Toolbox (PF2)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The oil-soaked bridge leaps into flames.

Skeletal hands burst from the soil and clutch at your ankles.

The massive stone you stand on flies through the air and crashes into the cloud giant as you leap off and attack.

Every battle take place somewhere, thus every battle features terrain. Sometimes all you need is a place to stand, maybe some trees or ruins to provide cover, but sometimes you want more. You want your terrain to have a major impact on the story or the heroes' tactics. You want the the Fire Swamp or the Bridge of Khazad Dum.

That's what Terrain Toolbox is for.

Terrain Toolbox provides 48 sample terrains you can drop into combat, like a blood mage's circle, solid clouds, and lightning pillars. Each sample terrain includes cosmetic and rules variations, giving you hundreds of possibilities. Plus the book offers advice to create your own terrain

boardgame.name: Adeptus Titanicus: The Defence of Ryza
boardgame.description:
The forge world of Ryza is second only to Mars in its splendour. Famed for its innovative plasma technologies, it is a prime target for the Dark Mechanicum and their ally, the Warmaster Horus. As the forces of the traitor Fabricator-General, Kelbor-Hal, attack, Ryza's defenders prepare to sell their lives dearly for their world.

Discover the dramatic events of the Defence of Ryza in this 108-page hardback supplement for Adeptus Titanicus, alongside a host of new rules to use in your games. Harness the strengths of six different Titan Legions using four new maniples, and bring the might of six Knight Households to bear against your enemies. Create your own Legions, choosing from a massive variety of rules, and declare your allegiance to the Emperor or Horus – or forge your own path as mercenary Blackshields. Play out the story across six narrative missions, complete with new environment rules and stratagems – however you want to play, you'll find new rules for you.

—description from the publisher

CONTENTS
– An overview of the Defence of Ryza
– Background and Legion-specific rules for six Titan Legions: Honorum, Osedax, Crucius, Magna, Vulturum and Mortis
– Four new maniples to use in your games
– Background and rules for six Knight Houses: Sidus, Taranis, Zavora, Morbidia, Ioeden and Oroborn
– Full colour examples of paint schemes and heraldry for Titans and Knights
– Six narrative missions based on the dramatic events of the story
– Three different allegiances for your Titan Legions, and four for your Knight Houses
– Rules for creating your own Titan Legions, including 16 Traits, 15 Stratagems, and 21 pieces of Wargear
– Battle Standards, Lance Standards and High Kings to expand your Knight Households
– New environments: Manufactoria, Plasmatic Infrastructure and Ryza Secundus
– 11 new Stratagems to use in your games

A copy of the Adeptus Titanicus rules is required to use the contents of this book.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: Adeptus Titanicus – The Horus Heresy (Games Workshop)
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Adeptus Titanicus: The Horus Heresy Rules Set

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Maastricht
boardgame.description:
An edition of the commercially successful board game, Monopoly. This edition takes in the Dutch city of Maastricht.
Popular and well known areas are for sale including Koestraat, the Markt, the Kleine Staat and the Vrijthof.

boardgame.name: Tall Tales of the Snowshoe Halflings
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tall Tales of the Snowshoe Halflings introduces a new variant race into your world. The snowshoe halflings are a tenacious group of expert hunters and survivalists, perfect for arctic settings, but easily adaptable to any harsh environment you might find yourself in. The supplement also contains three new subclasses originating in snowshoe tradition:

The Huntmaster archetype is for snowshoe fighters who specialize in taking down foes many times their size.
The Myth Domain is perfect for clerics who believe that words are the mightest weapons.
The Trailblazer archetype endows rangers with the power of fire, making them beacons of light and hope in the wilderness.


Also included in this supplement is a set of new items and 3 new monsters that populate the halfling's world.

This is the first release in a series of arctic- themed races and subclasses, building towards the eventual publishing of a brand new setting. For this release, the history and lore of the snowshoe halflings has been simplified to make them more broadly usable in your games.

So grab your snowshoes and get adventuring!

boardgame.name: Trailblazer Ranger Archetype
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This supplement introduces a brand new ranger archetype into your game: the Trailblazer. Blessed with the power of fire, Trailblazers strike out into a cold, dark world to protect their people and seek the warmth and comfort of safer lands. This archetype originates, culturally, with the Snowshoe Halflings, a variant race who are not mentioned, but not included, in this release.

boardgame.name: Archetypes of Power 2
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Archetypes of Power 2 is a collection of new archetypes and class options for the Spheres of Power and Spheres of Might systems. Whether you’re a wraith whose power mimics the dreaded banshees, a professional soldier looking to make your fortune, or a blacksmith who forges spells as well as steel, Archetypes of Power 2 contains exactly what you need to build the characters of your dreams!

boardgame.name: Liber Genus V: Werecreature
Werecreature
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Have you ever looked at a creature and thought, "hmm, that would be interesting to play"? Have you thought it a shame that some creatures look like you could walk down the street in your game as one yet there are no hard rules on how to do that? Well the Liber Genus series aims to fill that niche.

This fith installment brings the cursed werecreatures to the table, with rules on how to create a character as a versatile ancestry as well as an archetype anyone can take. Incorporating 1 versatile heritage as well as 6 feats shared between the ancestry and archetype, 2 focus spells and a ritual.

boardgame.name: Murder at the Ruptured Troll
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Murder at the Ruptured Troll was the first actual short story that Ken wrote about what life was like for people living on Trollworld. Set in Khosht, the first town created to act as a headquarters for dungeon delvers and other adventurers, Murder sets the scene in a humorous way for a world where many kinds of humanoid creatures intermingle freely. The protagonists of this tale are human, but the other characters are elves, dwarves, uruks, hobbs, goblins and trolls. It features everyone's favorite sexy adventuress, Flaming Cherry. In addition to being a rousing story that will keep you chuckling all the way through, the book also gives instructions for playing the story as a short, introductory scenario for Deluxe Tunnels and Trolls, a good way to get new players into the world, and a new GM into his/her duties as the Master of the Game. The story has undergone a few minor updates to make it consistent with the current deluxe edition of T & T.

boardgame.name: Automata
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to Automata, a mod for the Sigil System that deals with artificial intelligences, automatons, robots, golems, characters forged for war, cybernetics, prosthetics, steametics and so much more.

Automata is all about the artificial and changing the organic into mechanic. Whether that is simply augmenting what God gave you to become harder, better, faster and stronger; or going all in to put your mind and soul into a machine, to live forever more as a metal automaton. If you wish to push the boundaries of technology and what the human body can do, Automata is for you.

boardgame.name: The Value of Crystal
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An influential noble depends on the adventurers’ skills to retrieve a family heirloom from an ex-fiancée after a bad breakup. The problem is that the heirloom — and the former lover — is on a heavily-secured research station owned by a star-spanning corporation not known for their kindness. It remains to be seen if the heroes can survive murderous armed guards, being in the middle of a relationship gone sour, and learning the secrets of their target.

The Value of Crystal is a short adventure for 2D6 science fiction RPGs such as Cepheus Engine and the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game (OSFRPG.)

boardgame.name: Cepheus Engine Mission Generator
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The galaxy’s a big place; big enough for any and all kinds of adventure. But where do star-spanning heroes find such exploits? Right here in the Cepheus Engine Mission Generator! Using little more than 2 six-sided dice and a modicum of imagination, the Referee of a Cepheus Engine or Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game campaign can generate one of over 90,000 different missions in mere minutes. And the process is generic enough that it’s usable for any other science fiction game system, or even other genres, if the Referee tweaks the results right.

The Cepheus Engine Mission Generator. Big adventures for a big galaxy.

boardgame.name: The Zoanthrope Base Class
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world is filled with creatures of all manner and shape. Savage, mystical, alien. Some malign, some benevolent. The struggle to survive as the civilized races settle and explore has them contesting with creatures of our own plane and those adjacent, for dominance, or just survival. The Zoanthrope are those who make their way through this uncertain world by fighting fire with fire, they perform rituals that infuse their spirits and mutate their bodies to match the power and ferocity of various creatures.

boardgame.name: Creature Tokens Pack 09
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Another Batch of CR 1/2 SRD Creatures + Couple Bonus ones

All tokens are in PNG format and DOUBLE our usual resolution (400dpi) just in case you need a bigger version (for example Enlarge spell) you wont lose any detail :)

This pack contains 14 new Creature Tokens, each with multiple color variants.

boardgame.name: Creature Tokens Pack 08
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

All tokens are in PNG format and high resolution (400dpi) just in case you need a bigger version

(for example Enlarge spell) you wont lose any detail.

First half of CR 1/2 SRD Creatures + Couple Bonus ones.

This pack contains 13 new Creature Tokens, each with multiple color variants.

Total # of tokens in this pack: 105!

boardgame.name: Adversaries - Goblins
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

All tokens are in PNG format and high resolution (400dpi) just in case you need a bigger version (for example Enlarge spell) you wont lose any detail.

This pack consists of 12 unique Goblin tokens, each wearing different armor and weapon.

+ Every token/asset is available in 10 color variants!

Total # of tokens in this pack: 140!

boardgame.name: Máxima Definición
boardgame.description:
Máxima Definición is a free print and play board game, a simple game in which we will pretend to be playing a soccer game which has ended up tied, after extra time everything will be defined in the penalty shootout. Each player will intersperse roles as goalkeeper and as a player who kicks the penalty, they will have to choose carefully the different pieces to save and score ... who will win this match?

The game has a solitaire mode playing against an AI, the other mode is 2 players, but even more players can be played each pair with a copy of the game. Build your penalty tournaments and become the Maximum Definition champion.
The language independent game as the components only have icons.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Make Your Own Caves (Revised) - Modular Caves Tile Set
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Fully modular Cave wall tiles, that you can snap together seamlessly to create a sprawling cave of your choice.
You can combine this set with our Cave Cliff/Ridge Tiles as well for more flexibility!

boardgame.name: Adventure Generator 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

10 More Adventure Outlines! This second volume Adventure Generator is a reusable toolkit for any tabletop fantasy roleplaying system or setting. With only a few die rolls you’ll have an outline for an exciting story with clear objectives and a distinct beginning, middle, and end. From there you can customize it to fit your world, your player characters, and your style of play. No generic, single-sentence plot hooks or vague adventure seeds! The Adventure Generator will provide you with enough substance to get you started on creating a unique and challenging roleplaying experience.

The process of generating an adventure is simple:


Roll once on the Random Adventure Table. This will lead you to a high-level story outline that you can build upon. There are 10 five-encounter outlines included.
Roll once on the Random Environment Table. The result is the primary environment for the adventure. There are 13 types of environments listed.
Roll once on the Random Adversary Table. This is the main opponent or predominant creature type throughout the adventure. There are 15 creature types listed.
Roll once on the Random Theme Table (Optional). Give your adventure an overarching theme. There are 10 common themes listed.

boardgame.name: Adventure Generator
boardgame.description:

This Adventure Generator is a reusable toolkit for any tabletop fantasy roleplaying system or setting. With only a few die rolls you’ll have an outline for an exciting story with clear objectives and a distinct beginning, middle, and end. From there you can customize it to fit your world, your player characters, and your style of play. No generic, single-sentence plot hooks or vague adventure seeds! The Adventure Generator will provide you with enough substance to get you started on creating a unique and challenging roleplaying experience.

Roll once on the Random Environment Table. The result is the primary environment for the adventure. There are 13 types of environments listed.
Roll once on the Random Adversary Table. This is the main opponent or predominant creature type throughout the adventure. There are 15 creature types listed.
Roll once on the Random Theme Table (Optional). Give your adventure an overarching theme. There are 10 common themes listed.

boardgame.name: Cantrip - A Fantasy Roleplaying System
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Cantrip Fantasy is a simple, easy-to-learn tabletop roleplaying system. It was designed for people who’d like to play something like that big, brand-name fantasy game but feel overwhelmed by big, fat books full of rules. This system was also created for people who don’t like being limited to the character options in those books, and would like to create their own.

There are only three basic steps that you need to follow in order to play:


Step 1: Make a Character.
Step 2: Have Adventures.
Step 3: Repeat as Desired.


Cantrip Fantasy uses six-sided dice. You will need a lot of them. Pencils and paper are helpful, too. Anything else, like miniature figures, funny hats, and snacks are completely optional. The assumption is that at least one person playing is familiar with the basics of tabletop roleplaying, and can act as the guide for the other players.

boardgame.name: Domnio
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Running a one-shot or short campaign, and need a system that doesn’t require a lot of prep? Wondering how to introduce roleplaying to people intimidated by big rulebooks? Be ready to play within minutes using Domnio!

Domnio is a 4-page PDF packed with all of the information you need to create characters and run the game. The minimalist presentation uses every bit of space on useful content.

boardgame.name: Escape Mail
boardgame.description:
Escape Mail is an escape room in an envelope. Season 1 consists of 12 episodes which all follow the the story of your long lost cousin, JJ Fitzpatrick in your combined search for lost family treasure.

Episode 1 is an envelope addressed to you from your cousin JJ with some mysterious contents, and a letter stating that you and your family are entitled to a wealth of treasure, if you're smart enough to find it. What you don't know yet is just where this adventure will take you! Do you have what it takes to solve the mystery and claim your family's treasure?

The game can be completed in single standalone episodes or the entire 12 episode campaign arc can be purchased.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Fading Embers Setting Primer
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fading Embers is a post-apocalyptic fantasy setting for 5e

It takes place 900 years after the world of Nyth was plunged into a sudden ice age.

Most people live in city-states, separated by wild lawless lands.

The Fading Embers Setting Primer is an introductory supplement for the setting.

Details on each of the 12 Major Nations remaining in the world
Setting map and Timeline
List of playable races; full rules for 3:


- Elves of Nyth
- Lycan-Blooded
- Yeti

List of new subclasses; full rules for 4:


- Blood Clerics
- Alchemical Maverick Fighters
- Monks of the Enduring Soul
- Transference Sorcery

Superior Quality equipment rules
5 New Spells
11 New Magic Items
New Monster Rules for Aberrations, the Fey, and Lycanthropes
Optional Travel & Survival Rules
3 Different Introductory Level Adventures, including new monsters


- “The Price of Power” 1st level hostage retrieval
- “Freedoms Path” 0th level escape from enslavement
- “The Beast in Us All” 1st level troubled town sandbox

boardgame.name: Warhammer Underworlds: A Crushing Terror
boardgame.description:
Solo game scenario for Warhammer Underworlds that allows a single player to pit their warband against a rampaging Fomoroid Crusher. The player wins the game by defeating the monster before it can escape off the board - or take all of their fighters out of action.

—description from the publisher

Nusfjord: Salmon Deck
boardgame.description: Nusfjord: Salmon Deck contains 44 new building cards for players who have a good understanding of the base game, as well as 25 metal coins to replace the coins from the base game.

boardgame.name: Something Wicked
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

There is far, far more to this world than meets the eye... a darkness that exists just beyond the light of the world that most of us know and observe.

It is there, on the fringe of reality, patiently lying in wait...

The tales of evil beyond our comprehension that have been whispered for millennia around the campfire. The urban legends about dark rituals, blood sacrifices and secret societies. Terrifying rumours of witchcraft and black magic being used to raise the dead and summon demons under the light of the full moon.

All of these stories are true.

Evil and wickedness exists. It can be found violently piercing the veil for those few who know how and where to look.

People like you.

Something Wicked is a roleplaying game of pulp horror and mystery for 3–5 players. It uses a lightweight, streamlined engine to get you up and playing fast!

boardgame.name: Flames of War: Dietrich's Ghosts
boardgame.description:
The dust got into everything.
Feldwebel Unger tied his handkerchief tighter across his nose and mouth, knowing it would make little difference, he could already feel the grit against his teeth.
His platoon was sweeping across the steppes of the Eastern Ukraine, chasing the broken remnants of many Soviet armies.
His Panzer IV had made it through a harsh winter and savage Red Army attacks around Kharkov, but now they were pushing back.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Gruesome Ghoulies: The Spooky RPG of Cartoon Hijinks
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You are a Ghoulie: Slightly greenish skin, black clothes, black finger nails, black circles around beady eyes, drive a hot rod, sleep during the day, like macabre things, and live in a graveyard. Yet you work undetected in town with regular humans, as a Beautician, Mortician, Electrician, Physician, Politician, Hot Rod Technician, or a Fry Cook. Still, you and your ghoulish friends dream of becoming Musicians, so you started a garage band. Oh yeah, there is one more thing... A few cranky townsfolk know who you are and try to expose you, every day. Ghoulies can’t hurt humans, but they can scare them, get them arrested, expose their crimes, send them on a long trip, or embarrass them in a Battle of the Bands.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Core Set
boardgame.description:
User summary:

2e Adventure Tiles kick-off with the Dungeon Core Set. This set of 46 miniatures scale terrain tiles contains 30 basic dungeon tiles, 10 dungeon stairways to travel between levels, and 6 transition tiles compatible with e-Adventure Tiles: Cave-Dungeon Links "Dungeon" sets.

boardgame.name: Labyrinth Core Set
boardgame.description:
User summary:

2e Adventure Tiles continues with the Labyrinth Core Set. This set of 73 miniatures scale terrain tiles contains 70 basic labyrinth tiles that can be used to create a huge variety of mazes for your fantasy RPG adventures. While this set if already compatible with 2e Adventure Tiles: Dungeon Core Set, the final 3 transition tiles make this set compatible with e-Adventure Tiles: Cave-Dungeon Links "Dungeon" sets as well.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Expansion 01
boardgame.description:
User summary:

2e Adventure Tiles continues with Dungeon Expansion 01. This expansion set contains 9 tiles loaded with details for your encounters. Each of those 9 tiles also has a version without all the encounter details so you can stock it as you see fit. If a tile has an asymmetrical design, the two versions of that tile will be mirror images of one another for more variety. The final 2 tiles are transition tiles compatible with e-Adventure Tiles: Cave-Dungeon Links "Dungeon" sets.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Expansion 02
boardgame.description:
User summary:

2e Adventure Tiles continues with Dungeon Expansion 02. This expansion set contains 9 tiles detailing a large circular room with a draconic shrine. Each of those 9 tiles also has a version without all the encounter details so you can stock it as you see fit. The arcs of the curved walls are designed to line up perfectly with the straight walls of other 2e Dungeon sets for infinite compatibility. The final 2 tiles are transition tiles compatible with e-Adventure Tiles: Cave-Dungeon Links "Dungeon" sets.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Expansion 03 - Wizard's Workshop
boardgame.description:
User summary:

2e Adventure Tiles continues with Dungeon Expansion 03 - Wizard's Workshop. This set of 26 miniatures scale terrain tiles contains everything you need to create a detailed arcane workshop. Areas of the workshop include a summoning chamber, scrying chamber, library, study, alchemy lab, containment cells, sleeping quarters for a guard or assistant, and more. Alternate versions of the tiles tone down the arcane elements for use with any type of dungeon. Two of the tiles provide links with 2e Adventure Tiles: Labyrinth Core Set.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Encounter 01
boardgame.description:
User summary:

2e Adventure Tiles continues with Dungeon Encounter 01. This set contains 12 tiles detailing variations of a room with a long narrow staircase and a defensible platform. This encounter is perfect for an ambush against your characters or as a defensive point where adventurers can fend off an incoming horde of creatures. Four of the tiles are designed to link this encounter with other specific tile sets and let you expand your options even further.

boardgame.name: Dwarven Tomb
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Delve into darkness with 2e Adventure Tiles: Dwarven Tomb. This set of 46 tiles features a detailed crypt with light but versatile dwarven themes throughout. Each tile has a clean version and a decrepit version featuring signs of tomb robbers, cultists, spiders, fungi, and more. Each tile is 6" x 6" and features a one inch grid.

Three formats are included in the digital download - Printer Friendly PDF, Printer Killer PDF, and Jpegs for use in VTT.

boardgame.name: Dungeons: 51 Dungeons for Fantasy Tabletop Role-Playing Games and More
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Get 51 dungeons to cut down your gamemaster prep time.

This book contains 51 dungeon maps with descriptions, plus 5 cities, 5 manors, and 2 inns. All are ready to be added into your RPG campaign or to give you ideas for a new one.

Each entry contains maps, descriptions and idea prompts, so they can be tailored to your table and provide inspiration. Also, bonus random tables are included to help fill in details quickly.

boardgame.name: Necromancer's Cave
boardgame.description:
User summary:

2e Adventure Tiles: Necromancer's Cave takes you into the horrific workplace of a Necromancer. This set of 46 tiles features a detailed cavern filled with themes of undead experimentation. Features include arcane circles, dissection tables, fluid tanks, embalming pools, lots of bones and blood, and more. Each tile also has a "clean" version without the necromantic themes for use in any cave delving adventure. Each tile is 6" x 6" and features a one inch grid.

Three formats are included in the digital download - Printer Friendly PDF, Printer Killer PDF, and Jpegs for use in VTT.

boardgame.name: Forgotten Temple
boardgame.description:
User summary:

2e Adventure Tiles continues with the Forgotten Temple. This set of 24 miniatures scale terrain tiles contains everything you need to create a detailed temple to a warrior god. Tiles in this set feature huge statues, rune painted floors, a pool, and clergy dorms. Alternate versions of the tiles take the hallowed halls and make them unhallowed with heavy cobwebs, fungi, profane symbols, structural damage, and more. Many of the details in this set crossover with 2e Adventure Tiles: Dwarven Tomb.

Digital Edition: This includes all 24 tiles in both Printer Friendly and Printer Killer PDFs. Print all you want and start playing. It also include all 24 tiles as 100ppi jpegs with dark backgrounds for use with virtual tabletop applications.

Print Edition: The print version of this product includes 16 double sided tiles. Each detailed tile has the simpler alternate version printed on the back and you get two copies of key tiles that will have multiple uses in your builds.

boardgame.name: Sorcerous Study
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

5th Edition Mini-Dungeon for four to five characters of levels 4-5

Floating in the clouds, some 6,000 ft. above, the purpose of these isles is lost to the sands of time. Recently, they have been converted into a powerful wizard’s study for the purpose of researching the Elemental Planes.

boardgame.name: Don't Rest Your Head Jump
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

What’s been keeping you awake?

You can’t sleep. First you couldn’t, now you shouldn’t. Maybe you were binging a hundred hours on getting a research paper done, maybe you spent sleepless nights on the run from the mob. Maybe you just liked your coffee (don’t we all?). You stayed awake for so long, you passed through the veil of exhaustion and into the other side where sleep is a choice and no longer a need.

User summary:

This solitaire adventure is based on Don't Rest Your Head.

boardgame.name: Unlock!: Lastman
boardgame.description:
Lastman is a French series of graphic novels created by Bastien Vivès, Balak and Michaël Sanlaville.

"Unlock! Lastman" is a 24-card mini-adventure in the Unlock! series of card-driven escape room games. It is only for 1 to 2 players, ages 10 and over and plays in about 15 minutes.

Some bookstores in France gave this out to customers who bought two Lastman books.

It requires a free companion app to play.

Collect the clues and solve the puzzles to find out!

The Fairy Tale Files are lighthearted murder mystery detective games inspired by iconic fairy tales. We bring you the delight of your favorite childhood stories with an adult twist! Join the Magical Mishaps Agency to solve the clues and find the killer!

boardgame.name: Until the Bitter End: Tanks

Until the Bitter End - Tanks is a World War 2 wargame. This is the third game in the Until the Bitter End series and the first that focuses, solely, on tank (and other armoured fighting vehicles) battles. This is a print and play game for solitaire and two-players. This is a standalone game in my series of WW2 print and play games. boardgame.name: Monopoly: Benevento Calcio
boardgame.description:
In the 90th year since its foundation, Benevento Calcio is the first Serie B team to join the large Monopoly family.

Play with the protagonists of the 2019/2020 season and relive the emotions related to the recent history of the Samnite Club. Challenge friends and relatives, manage your finances in the best possible way, show all your Giallorossi passion and become the champion of Benevento Calcio Monopoly.


Nel 90esimo anno dalla sua fondazione, il Benevento Calcio é la prima squadra della Lega Serie B ad entrare nella grande famiglia del Monopoly.

Gioca con i protagonisti della stagione 2019/2020 e rivivi le emozioni legate alla storia recente del Club sannita. Sfida amici e parenti, amministra al meglio le tue finanze, mostra tutta la tua passione giallorossa e diventa il campione di Benevento Calcio Monopoly.

boardgame.name: Monopoly: SSC Napoli
